intro: Rubus colemannii subsp. halacsyi, commonly known as the Halácsy bramble, is a shrub native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or black in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
